metadata.title: CVE-2024-38632 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:vfio/pci: fix potential memory leak in vfio_intx_enable() Ifvfio_irq_ctx_alloc() failed will lead to 'name' memory leak.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-38632` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-127-generic - 5.15.0-127.137
linux-image-5.15.0-127-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-127.137
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-127-generic - 5.15.0-127.137
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-127-generic-64k - 5.15.0-127.137
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-14-generic - 6.5.0-14.14~22.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-14-generic - 6.5.0-14.14~22.04.1

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-127.137').
